description: An order is a confirmation of a transaction (a receipt), which can contain multiple line items, each represented by an Offer that has been accepted by the customer.
title: Order

orderDelivery.description: The delivery of the parcel related to this order or order item.

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

partOfInvoice.description: The order is being paid as part of the referenced Invoice.

orderStatus.description: The current status of the order.

discountCurrency.description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the discount.

additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

acceptedOffer.description: The offer(s) -- e.g., product, quantity and price combinations -- included in the order.

isGift.description: Was the offer accepted as a gift for someone other than the buyer.

confirmationNumber.description: A number that confirms the given order or payment has been received.

paymentMethodId.description: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

paymentDue.description: The date that payment is due.

seller.description: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

mainEntityOfPage.description:
Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.

See background notes for details.

paymentMethod.description: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

description.description: A short description of the item.

broker.description: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

paymentUrl.description: The URL for sending a payment.

billingAddress.description: The billing address for the order.

paymentDueDate.description: The date that payment is due.

customer.description: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

discountCode.description: Code used to redeem a discount.
